image.altText: A large LNG tank sits among mangrove trees, Darwin's skyline is visible in the background

props.synopsis: The CSIRO says its advice to gas giant Santos over a major methane leak should stay secret to protect its "commercial activities". The Clean Energy Regulator says it has no records of its advice.

title.children: Federal agencies face backlash over role in hidden gas leak 'scandal'

image.altText: A woman wearing a bright pink blazer sits in parliament.

props.synopsis: The scrutiny comes after Chief Minister Lia Finocchiaro recently went almost seven weeks without holding a press conference in Darwin.

title.children: NT government under fire over lack of transparency, scrutiny avoidance

image.altText: A close-up of a man with dark hair and blue eyes.

props.synopsis: After a month-long trial, Matt Wright was last week found guilty on two counts of attempting to pervert the course of justice by a Supreme Court jury. So, what's next in the case of the celebrity crocodile wrangler?

title.children: Found guilty of hindering chopper crash probe, what's next for Matt Wright?

image.altText: The inside of a museum.

props.synopsis: Exhibits from a significant natural and earth science collection will go into storage as an Alice Springs museum is closed for good.

title.children: Museum of Central Australia closes as visitor numbers fall

image.altText: close up sign of Optus

props.synopsis: The Federal Court has heard vulnerable Optus customers who were homeless, unemployed or receiving disability payments were wrongfully sold services and products.

title.children: Inappropriate 'pattern of behaviours' from Optus staff revealed

image.altText: A young  girl in a pilots uniform standing in front of float plane, holding blonde golden retriever puppy, who has tongue out

props.synopsis: A 15-year-old girl from the Northern Territory is looking to break a record, as the youngest female to fly around Australia solo. And her golden retriever puppy, Bella, will be joining her for the ride.

title.children: 15yo girl and her puppy embark on record-breaking flight around Australia

image.altText: Two women sit in a nurses office, the woman in the foreground teaching the second woman.

props.synopsis: Helen Lemach says her job is about building relationships and trust as much as telling people what they can do to change their lifestyles.

title.children: Diabetes educator wins national award for fighting 'silent killer'

image.altText: An aerial view of the town of Katherine, showing the main street and the roofs of businesses and houses.

props.synopsis: Police say a woman has died of a suspected snake bite in the regional Northern Territory town of Katherine after she collapsed on Monday afternoon and was unable to be revived by paramedics.

title.children: Woman dies of suspected snake bite after collapsing at NT business

image.altText: A man and a woman in running gear stand in front of an Aboriginal flag smiling.

props.synopsis: Charlie Maher has become the first Indigenous man to complete all seven major marathons in the world.

title.children: Indigenous runner grateful for historic world marathon feat

image.altText: A woman looking through the rear view mirror in a car.

props.synopsis: An ABC investigation has uncovered hundreds of allegations of sexual harassment and assault at the hands of driving instructors. Warning: graphic content detailing alleged sexual assault.

title.children: 'No escaping it': Shocking allegations of sexual assault over six decades

image.altText: A sign with a photo of Epstein and Maxwell, urging peole to call if they have been a victim, is pointed to.

props.synopsis: After weeks of growing pressure, the US House Committee has released part of the Epstein files. But it's unlikely to give people the answers they were hoping for.

title.children: Why the 'Epstein Files' drop may not be what MAGA hoped for

image.altText: A man wearing a dark shirt stands outside a courthouse

props.synopsis: Police say the 32-year-old, who was already on bail for separate charges, poses an unacceptable risk to the community.

title.children: Neo-Nazi to face bail decision on Friday after arrest over alleged attack

image.altText: Crows player Izak Rankine in casual clothes.

props.synopsis: Adelaide Crows head coach Matthew Nicks has said suspended star Izak Rankine is "in a pretty good space" following his return to the club after an overseas break.

title.children: Rankine addresses Crows teammates after returning from overseas break

image.altText: Welder works at InQuik Engineering in Newcastle.

props.synopsis: The Australian economy has grown slightly faster than economists were expecting thanks to a dramatic increase in household spending, increasing expectations that the RBA might be close to done with rate cuts.

title.children: Stronger economic data raises prospect of just one more rate cut

image.altText: Chloe Malle wearing an off-white sparkly dress with capped sleeves, a v-neckline and flower details

props.synopsis: Chloe Malle's mother Candice Bergen played a Vogue editor on Sex and the City. Now she's taking over from Anna Wintour.

title.children: How a 'proud nepo baby' will change the face of Vogue

image.altText: A young boy smiling

props.synopsis: A woman who lost control of her SUV and crashed into a group of students at Auburn South Primary School, killing a boy, has been convicted and fined $2,000.

title.children: Melbourne school crash driver fined, but will have to live with guilt of ‘killing a kid’

image.altText: Man holding phone horizontally while wearing body camera on a property that looks like a farm with mountain in the background

props.synopsis: Police say more than 100 properties have been searched as the hunt continues for the gunman who allegedly killed two police officers in north-east Victoria.

title.children: More than 100 properties searched in hunt for alleged killer Dezi Freeman

image.altText: Antoinette Lattouf in a black top, on a CBD street, speaking into a micrphone.

props.synopsis: Antoinette Lattouf's lawyers returned to the Federal Court on Wednesday to push for a financial penalty of $300,000-$350,000 to be imposed for ABC's contraventions of the Fair Work Act.

title.children: Lattouf's lawyers push for $350k penalty over unlawful sacking from ABC

image.altText: A stylised collage shows polaroid frames around photos of a young boy, and a young man at centre

props.synopsis: WA police commissioner Col Blanch says police "need to be better" after a constable admitted ignoring a warning that a detainee was going to kill himself, then laughed when he did.

title.children: WA Police apologise after officer laughed at detainee's suicide

image.altText: A close-up of the face of a greyish-brown elephant seal lounging in shallow water.

props.synopsis: Sammy the seal often pops up in the seaside Victorian town of Portland and has recently been photographed munching on a shark. He is loved by many, but authorities are warning people to keep their distance.

title.children: Shark-eating seal returns to Portland, prompting warnings for admirers

image.altText: Sonia Morell wears a pale green jumper and stands in a rugged landscape with red rocks and an escarpment in the distance.

props.synopsis: Sonia dreamed of travelling but was trapped by anxiety. In her 30s she finally decided to tackle her fear by booking a trip within Australia.

title.children: How I overcame anxiety to travel solo

image.altText: A man holds a placard.

props.synopsis: A Tasmanian independent MP who received more than $72,000 in donations from Climate 200 says he will divest his shares in a fossil fuel company, miner and pokies venue operator, as they do not align with his values.

title.children: Progressive politician has shares in mining, pokies

image.altText: Man with grey hair, black rimmed glasses and dark grey shirt looks at camera

props.synopsis: Michael Alford says his wife and he have been left in a "financial no-man's-land" after years spent trying to resolve suspicious transactions that have appeared in the couple's bank accounts without success.

title.children: Couple 'broken, nearly bankrupt' after years of mysterious bank withdrawals

image.altText: This vision shows the moments leading up to the tasering of an Indigenous man by police in Kalgoorlie

props.synopsis: The WA corruption watchdog is reviewing police conduct over an incident where officers twice shoved a man to the ground before tasering him on a Kalgoorlie street.

title.children: 'Police-induced jeopardy': Aboriginal man tasered after giving cops the finger

image.altText: Raymond Kelly stands outdoors with aboriginal flag in background, speaking to crowd

props.synopsis: The High Court of Australia has ruled in favour of the La Perouse Local Aboriginal Land Council, affirming its claim on disputed land in Sydney's Paddington.

title.children: 'Justice for Aboriginal people' after Sydney bowling club court verdict

image.altText: Trinity de Lance holds her arms above her to signal the end of her beam routine and looks to the side.

props.synopsis: A report by an international ethics body finds Gymnastics Australia breached the human rights of a 12-year-old girl who broke her back while training in excruciating pain.

title.children: Ethics body finds Gymnastics Australia breached 12yo's human rights

image.altText: Alex de Minaur smiles while holding tennis balls at the US Open.

props.synopsis: Alex de Minaur knows he needs a few things to go his way to push "all the way" at the grand slams, and he has finally caught some breaks in New York.

title.children: De Minaur needs a little luck to push further. He's got it at the US Open

image.altText: High Court of Australia, building, generic

props.synopsis: The man is one of three people who were slated to be removed to Nauru in February under the government's newly minted agreement with the island nation, which was stepped up at the weekend with a $400 million deal.

title.children: Iraqi asylum seeker slated for removal to Nauru loses High Court challenge

image.altText: Jeffrey Epstein in a bright yellow jacket stands grinning in front of a small black plane

props.synopsis: Following growing speculation over the president's ties to the disgraced financier, the Trump administration had called for the files to be released.

title.children: First batch of Epstein files released after Trump administration push

image.altText: white man wears glasses and a white t shirt that says 'trans women are not women'

props.synopsis: In one of the posts, Linehan said that "if a trans-identified male is in a female-only space, he is committing a violent, abusive act".

title.children: Father Ted creator Graham Linehan arrested over transgender posts on X

image.altText: Two young boys with white paint stripes under their eyes stand among a crowd. A third pulls the arm of the boy in the middle

props.synopsis: Young Indonesians are taking to the streets to voice their anger at the government and police. This is how the protest turned into a riot.

title.children: 'I feel hopeless for this country': Why Indonesia's youth are rioting

image.altText: Sam with her small baby, smiling in a play area.

props.synopsis: Behind Australia's tug-of-war between office headquarters or working from home, a growing number of employers have found a middle ground, providing the best of both worlds for both their workers and their business.

title.children: A 10-minute commute over 90? Why workers are shifting to shared offices

image.altText: The March for Australia rally in Adelaide.

props.synopsis: South Australia's Acting Police Commissioner says she is "glad" a man seen holding a placard showing alleged police killer Dezi Freeman at an Adelaide rally turned himself in to police.

title.children: SA Police head welcomes arrest of man who displayed Dezi Freeman placard at rally

image.altText: A red Hyundai i30

props.synopsis: Thousands of Hyundai i30 vehicles are being recalled after a defect was found that may cause the engine to stall.

title.children: Thousands of Hyundai i30s recalled over potentially deadly manufacturing defect

image.altText: Three teenage girls stand together in front of a waterway.

props.synopsis: More than two years since catastrophic floods in WA's far north devastated a wildlife sanctuary, traditional owners have returned to country.

title.children: Bunuba people say 'it's good to be home' as they return after floods
